title: College of Health Careers - Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at Riverside Health System (Newport News, VA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions:
The entire process from application to start date was 49 calendar days; 28 calendar days from Recruiter contact to offer; and 15 calendar days with 3 in person interviews before an offer was extended.   The details of the process:  
I was contacted by the recruiter the week after applying to set up a basic 20 minute phone interview.   This was a basic yet thorough review of my resume, education, and background, the position, and some fundamental interview questions.   
Two days later the hiring manager called to set up a face-to-face interview for the following week.  This interview lasted over an hour covering some standards interview questions specific to the position and how my background fit with organization.   It was a very open and honest exchange with a lot of notes taken and that other candidates were being interviewed as well.  
Early the next week I was contacted to set up a 2nd interview with senior staff and the hiring manager for the following week.  The second face-to-face panel interview had more of a meeting feel with a conversational tone among the participants.  There were some direct questions on my approach to integrating into the team would look like etc.  
The following day the hiring manager invited me back for a tour and meet and greet of the staff the next day, and the following business day I was contacted by the Recruiter with an offer.  I started two weeks later.
Interview Questions: How do get buy in during change?

title: Intern - Hourly Interview

Overall, this process included a lot of different steps, but I was impressed at how quickly my start date followed my application submission. Also, the recruiter who helped me was very encouraging, helpful, and always gave a timely response.

1. Apply Online
2. Contacted within 24 hours
3. On-site Interview
4. Phone Interview; at the end, offered position, set up orientation dates and start date
5. Received official offer email 
6. Filled out New Hire Paperwork
7. Required Pre-Employment Physical and Payroll Processing Appointment
8. System-wide Orientation
9. Started the next day
